greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Exponents a(1), a(2), ... such that theta series of E_8 lattice, 1 + 240 q + 2160 q^2 + ... (A004009) is equal to (1-q)^a(1) (1-q^2)^a(2) (1-q^3)^a(3) ...
comment: Negative of inverse Euler transform of [240, 2160, ...].
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..424
formula: a(n) = A013953(n^2) for n>=1. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Jun 17 2017
a(n) = (1/n) * Sum_{d|n} A008683(n/d) * A289636(d). - _Seiichi Manyama_, Jul 09 2017
mathematica: sol[0] = {}; sol[kmax_] := sol[kmax] = Join[sol[kmax-1], SolveAlways[ Sum[ a4009[k] q^k, {k, 0, kmax}] == Normal[Product[(1-q^k)^a[k], {k, 1, kmax}] + O[q]^(kmax+1)] /. sol[kmax-1], q][[1]] ];
A110163 = Array[a, terms] /. sol[terms] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 03 2017 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 16 2005
